newsitem.title: LATVIA: Olainfarm rebounds, dominates Latvian bourse.
newsitem.headline: Olainfarm rebounds, dominates Latvian bourse.

text.p: Market newcomer Olainfarm rebounded on the Latvian bourse on Thursday and accounted for the lion's share of trade, but dealers remained divided over its value.
Overall market volume rose to 112,000 lats from 56,000 lats and the Rietumu index slipped 0.94 percent to 154.44.
Olainfarm, which lost almost 15 percent on Wednesday, leapt to 2.40 lats from 2.09 lats in trade of 91,700 lats.

Some dealers said that the pharmaceutical company, which made its bourse debut on Monday, has good long-term prospects and that its poor first quarter results do not give a clear picture of its potential. Others were less generous.
"The price seems to be held up artificially and its real value to my mind is closer to a bit over one lat," a dealer with Saules Bank told Reuters.
Most official list stocks held steady with only Unibanka easing. It lost 0.6 percent to 3.33 lats in trade of 1,000 lats.
Overall, dealers were in a bearish mood.
"No drastic changes are expected in the coming weeks," said one dealer.
"Local resources seem to have been drained and only an injection of foreign funds will liven things up," he said.
